item.title: Behind the scenes of a hit track
item.description: In 2017, revenues from recorded music in the United States were estimated at a retail value of $8.7 billion, this market includes streaming services, live shows, record labels, artists, song writing and video streaming, which relies heavily on a single factor, the success of a song.Record Labels and artists release thousands of songs across various genres to get a few hit songs to get return on their investment. Considering the size of this market, there still lies ambiguity in what makes a song popular. Many factors go into deciding the success of a song such as artist popularity, holiday season, internet mood, trending topics on the web and while a lot of them canâ€™t be controlled, there are many that can be. Music streaming apps such as Spotify, Apple Music pay the artists per stream, so it makes sense for music producers to want to maximize the number of streams their tracks get, so it becomes crucial to understand which factors significantly influence the popularity. The hypothesis to be tested was whether features such as audio properties, lyrics sentiment and artist popularity could impact the popularity of a song in-turn impacting the profits generated, and it was assumed that all marketing efforts by labels would yield equal results. The insights of the analysis can be used by music producers to get closer to increase profit margins in music production.
